summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2021 between a DOJ OIG Special Agent and a BOP Communication Technician regarding an OIG investigation into a DVR system failure at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on or around July 29, 2019. The technician provides details about replacing hard drives to fix the camera recording system, which was down. The OIG is seeking specific information about the work performed around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

keyFacts: The DOJ OIG was actively investigating a failure of the camera recording system (DVR #2) at the MCC New York that occurred on or around July 29, 2019.
A BOP Communication Technician repaired the system in July/August 2019 by replacing hard drives, using second-hand parts due to the equipment being at end-of-life.
The investigation sought to determine if the technician's work caused the system failure and what exactly was done, as they initially believed they had fixed the issue.
The context of this technical investigation is directly related to the time period surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the MCC on August 10, 2019.
The correspondence shows the OIG's detailed focus on obtaining work orders, purchase orders, and all related communications about the camera system issues prior to August 10, 2019.
